Reviews.Title: “Disaster! Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: emchandler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has gone to great lengths to maintain the older part of the hotel. Sadly, the rain came into the room 211 from the balconies damaging my luggage. Also, the AC is not adjustable by the guest and demands a call to the front desk for adjustment of temperature and fan speed. Inconvenient. NOISE POLLUTION IS TREMENDOUS AT NIGHT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Recently updated... a good Ponce option”
Reviews.Author: CookByMarriage
Reviews.Content: After reading the negative reviews, we were not expecting much. I am pleased to say that our 3rd floor room was recently redone. It felt fresh and clean. The bathroom was tiny, but looked pretty good. Some improvements to the shower (corroded shower head & noisy pipes) would still be welcome. The room itself was nicely done, clean & spacious enough. French doors with nice hardware lead to a narrow balcony. The view was framed by rather nice curtains. Furniture was fresh and standard "nice hotel" issue. We tried the cafe and restaurant in the hotel. We had good coffee & mallorcas at the cafe, and a very nice meal at the restaurant. The one drawback for this hotel is the noise. The walls are indeed thin. Fortunately all the guests around us were polite and considerate. Our room was near the ice maker, and that was ok too, (contrary to an earlier post.) It must have been fixed. Overall, we slept well and would stay here again if we ever returned to Ponce.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jossie R
Reviews.Content: This is a cute hotel in the center of Ponce. It has great location. The rooms at the main building are colonial-like decorated. It is good to stay over night or just a couple of nights. I would not recommend it for a long stay. The restaurant and coffee shop are excellent. We didn't use the pool but it was very clean and not crowded at all. Cons: They have no free parking. You have to pay $10 per night for valet parking. If you stay on Friday or Saturday nights you will hear the street and clubs noises. The shower water was either too hot to handle or too cold. Can't control A/C temperature from the colonial decor rooms. Pros: Location is great. You can walk to great restaurants and clubs, such as Equilibrium. La Pulga (Great shots) and Kenepa. The staff is great. Rooms (in the main yellow building) are spacious and bathrooms are huge. The view to the plaza and the center of Ponce are great too.

Reviews.Title: “An interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: kajofi
Reviews.Content: I spent one night last night at this hotel, located in Plaza las Delicias (Ponce's Town Square). My room was in the historic part. I reserved two weeks in advance so I got an excellent rate ($89.99). It was an quintessential Spanish room, with high ceiling, old style furnishing and an humongous bathroom which reminded me more of an apartment that a hotel room. I did not have wi-fi, but didn't matter in my case since I did not bring a laptop. The hallway afforded a view of the pool area and Lola Restaurant's outdoor dining area and bar. The noise from the live acoustic music did seep into my room but I booked so I could take a short trip to nearby Juana DÃ­az for a party so it did not affect me. The A/C's in the rooms on the historic part are controlled from reception so make sure it works properly if you book a room there. Ramada has an excellent restaurant (Lola) and a decent coffee shop (Melao) where I had dinner and breakfast, respectively. It also has valet parking for guest at an extra cost per day. My only major complaint is that this hotel does not offer continental breakfast and Melao, while good, is a bit expensive but there is a Burger King nearby if you wish to save a couple of dollars on breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: no_name344
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the building in the back since we needed 2 beds, the rooms are OK, beds are comfortable, the bed skirts were very dirty, although the sheets were clean, good parking facilities. The bathrooms are unacceptable. Just regular bath towels, no hand or wash cloths. The bathrooms were made from the cheapest materials available, not acceptable for a 3 1/2 star hotel. Even though when we checked in the room the bathroom was clean once you use the bathroom once it is a mess. Melao is a great coffee shop!!!! Highly recommended. Lola is a good restaurant. Very convenient location. One more thing, make sure you get a room very far away from the ice machines they are very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “ramada ponce the best in the city”
Reviews.Author: jose g
Reviews.Content: comfortable, lovely rooms, the best place in the city to stay 2 o 3 nigths, the front desk agents are so sweet and friendly, specialy natalhia and carlos...ask for the historical rooms

Reviews.Title: “Cute Colonial Place to stay at Ponce”
Reviews.Author: Isa D
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at 6 a.m., we were greeted by a kind and informed night desk agent. He was the friendliest of them all. I would have given a 5 if they other agents would at least look at me when I asked them questions. I asked about the complimentary breakfast posted on their website and was told by an agent who looked like he rather be elsewhere that they no longer do the free breakfast. I mentioned that it was on their website and that should be corrected. I didn't ask for any comps, however, upon returning to my room that evening, I was pleasantly surprised with an envelope with free breakfast at Melao. The food was great and the coffee was even better. I appreciate their efforts in rectifying that website error. The cashier at Melao was great at her job. Also, the housekeepers were very friendly and sweet. I enjoyed my room and my stay. I really only used the room to sleep as we were out early and back really late. The valet is kind of a joke but when they weren't around we just went to the Front Desk and retrieved our keys. I don't think they should charge $10 a day since it really ISNT valet services. Ponce is such a cute colonial town. Loved it there!!

Reviews.Title: “Photos deceiving, but still a good stay!”
Reviews.Author: JK F
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the Carnaval PonceÃ±o from Friday Feb 17 to Sunday Feb 19, I took this long for the review because I was waiting for the charger to my camera (more on that later). The nice yellow building houses the front desk, lobby, restaurant and kiddie pool (any adult would be embarrassed to get in this "pool"... VERY small... in the pic it looks big.. IT IS NOT!! There are 6 rooms in the yellow building which are the colonial style rooms with the checkered floor. There is another building in the back where the rest of the rooms are. My room was spacious and clean (very important). Bathroom was big as well. You can't control the A/C temperature in the room (bad job Ponce Ramada) The flat screen TV has your usual basic channels. You have a coffee maker in the room and housekeeping will bring you a coffee bag if you want to make more coffee. Valet Parking is 10 bucks a day, but they start at 11 am. I never needed my car before then though so it wasn't an inconvenience. The "fitness centre" is another joke like the pool. A padded floor with 3 little rinky-dink machines that felt like they were going to break when I got on (I'm 6'0" 215 lbs, so it wasn't me) This property should not even advertise a pool and fitness centre. The restaurant of the hotel "Lola's" seemed a bit pricey even though I heard great things about it, I did not eat there. Wasn't in the mood to splurge, especially with all the kiosks outside for the carnival with a wide variety of foods dirt cheap, be warned-- I came to Ponce because of the carnival, for the most part this is a ghost town. No pharmacy within walking distance-take note. I checked out and discovered when I got home that I left the charger for my camera in the room. (ARGGGGHHH!!!!) Valle from the front desk was very helpful and coordinated with housekeeping to get it back for me. Good job Valle! In summary: I would have given this property an "Average" rating but it will get a "Very Good' because of Valle's efforts to get my charger back. This hotel offers a clean room in an ideal location. Especially if you need a cheaper option in the Ponce area. i will be returning here again :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: HeleneDC
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel on the city plaza was a refreshing relaxing end to our PR trip. The views of Ponce were lovely. Ask for one of the historic rooms which are huge and beautifully furnished. The rate for the room ($106) was the same as for the rooms in the annex. Enjoyed coffee and good oatmeal at Melia's coffee shop. Hotel restaurant was also good. Parking is convenient - $10 for valet. Valet service doesn't open until 11 so we just kept our keys and left on our own. Close to Ponce Historical museum and large in door market. Interestingly, different museums are closed on different days so call ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, room disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tog
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for the location - ideally situated on the main square, so easy to walk around sightseeing from there. Didn't use the pool. It was small and in a shady courtyard. We had a room in the blue annexe behand the main old yellow building and the room was dark and pretty basic, though it had nice french windows opening on to the street. The bathroom could have done with updating - the tiled floor looked stained and not very clean, and the shower didn't work that well. To get to the lift you had to struggle with your luggage up a flight of stairs, which seemed a strange arrangement. We were only here one night so put up with it, but I wouldn't want a long stay. I'm sure the rooms in the restored old building must be nicer though, but are obviously more expensive. Wi-fi worked fine in the public rooms downstairs and by the pool but not in our room.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok...”
Reviews.Author: labeba
Reviews.Content: Not my favorite... Service was ok, it's located in the middle of the town, doesn't feel that safe, woke up in the middle of the night because people were to loud in the hallway, the front desk took care of it right away...

Reviews.Title: “The water heater doesn't work with the shower!”
Reviews.Author: Surfsid
Reviews.Content: Too expensive for the value. I have never been in a mayor chain Hotel with a portable water heater that does not work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gyos23
Reviews.Content: I want to start off by saying I'm biased. On the very first night, we were given the key cards to our room. Upon opening the door we noticed pieces of the ceiling had come down on the floor by the entrance. I went to complain and I was upgraded to one of their largest rooms; 225. I appreciated the gesture and enhanced my stay there. The room had a large bathroom, flat panel television, the choice to walk on to the terrace at any moment and a king sized bed. Downstairs within the hotel itself is a great restaurant called "Lola". There's also a coffee shop. Both a great places for food and drinks. The pool closes down at 6p because "Lola" rents it out for live music. The ambiance is great. The personell are all very friendly. The neighborhood is amongst the locals and so very laid back. There a places to go at night; the population is very friendly and put up with my horrible spanish. Great place in Puerto Rico. My first time in the country and I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “o.k. hotel in center of Ponce”
Reviews.Author: ape22
Reviews.Content: small hotel in the heart of the middle of Ponce ,high prices and very poor internet service very small bathrooms ,mediocre front desk excellent restaurant,very pricey but no room service and they make a point of letting you know. nice to relax in a safe area of ponce with nice museums but i did not have time to appreciate,not for handicapped or persons with special needs no luggage handlers must carry your suitcases up stairs just to get to first floor 1 elevator for the whole hotel starts on 2nd level. free internet when it works .

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: NBal
Reviews.Content: Nice,clean,comfortable... Lola Restaurant was very good

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Drvaldes
Reviews.Content: The pictures you see are for the front of the hotel, what they dont tell you is that there are only 6 rooms on that building and they get booked first (even though they cost the same). What they dont tell you is that the remaining 80 or so rooms are in a piece of crap building behind the front building. They changed our room 3 times and the three rooms were disgusting. Mold and mildew in the roof, floors and water leaks were the norm. No hot water to shower. We got congestion amost imediately in the 2nd and 3rd rooms. Safety was sketchy. In the end, after the 15 minutes we were there and decided to get a refund. They still had the audacity to try and charge us the full rate for the parking. I never write negative reviews as I am a business owner myself, but this went too far too fast.

Reviews.Title: “Most likely the best hotel in Ponce”
Reviews.Author: dqinpr
Reviews.Content: Not sure where the other complaints are coming from... This hotel is amazing. Stayed in the Colonial decor 40' by 30' room w 1 king bed. The room has 3 sets of french doors (incl small balcony), 20' cielings, glass walk in shower, etc. The area can be a little dicey, but the tourist police all most out number the locals so there's no need for worry. Clubs, dance classes, museums abound, and a trip to the boardwalk is nice. If you golf the Hilton is 10 minutes away (hope u can play in the wind). The Ramasa restaurant (Lola) can't be beat, the filet mignon / coconut flan has to be eaten. Book through Expidia for $88 /n (must book 1 day at a time for disc.)

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Ponce”
Reviews.Author: docchilie
Reviews.Content: If quiet, and beach is what you want, steer clear of this hotel; this is in the heart of Ponce, and I was staying here for business. So be aware, rush hour can be intense, therefore you may need to add some time if you have a distance to travel. This place is very clean, very new, expertly staffed, and has awesome rooms. Room 407 is a fantastic top floor suite with wrap around deck, if you are going for a romantic trip I would suggest requesting it (I'm not sure how I ended up in it). The hotel restaurant, Lola, is very good, and Archipielago is across the square. Ponce is a metropolitan city, so it is loud and busy. Also the cathedral in the square can wake you up in the morning; I would suggest a room as far West within the building they can give you. Be aware that Monday and Tuesday are the unofficial weekend for the entertainment industry in the town, so many restaurants, many bars, and some shops will all be closed for those days. The complementary breakfast is bare bones, but adequate, and the coffee does the trick. I don't know much about the nightlife around, but the two bars near the hotel I passed on the way back after a long day were packed. There is also valet parking with an entrance on the North end of the building. If valet is not your thing (I hate it), you can circumvent the process by finding the garage by entering from the alley in the West end of the building (off of Calle Mendez Vigo (a one way road bearing only north), and just before you get to Calle Reina Isabel). I do not know what this place costs, however I would come back here on my own dime with my wife, regardless of cost for a night. I say only for a night because the beaches in the South are not great, and I am not particularly into city life, but this is worth experiencing once in a while. By the way, the swimming pool is a joke, it is literally 7ft by 12ft, and 4ft deep. Serioulsy, they should just take it out and add more outdoor seating for Lola.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel bar kept us up until 2am”
Reviews.Author: pjmattal
Reviews.Content: This beautifully renovated hotel has a bar in the main building centrally located to the guest rooms, and was so loud it kept us up until at least 2am. We are from the city and used to noise. The noise outside was not the problem, just the noise from the bar itself. Great hotel if you're not planning to sleep until at least 2am.

Reviews.Title: “experience”
Reviews.Author: geothrm
Reviews.Content: 1. We got there at 2:00. Check-in is at 3:00. We were not allowed to check in early, though they did not appear to be busy. 2. We asked if they could hold our luggage until check-in time and were told they would not. 3. There is supposed to be high-speed internet available. I don't know how it is in the old section (which the desk said has wireless), but the new section (which has plug-in access) is NOT high-speed. It was slower than dial-up. After waiting 15 minutes for pages to load, I gave up. 4. The TV remote box didn't work. 5. The shower water alternates from steaming to freezing every minute or so. 6. We were given a pouch of coffee with no filter. 7. The bar had good drinks and appetizers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay. Not sure why anyone is complaining”
Reviews.Author: Tropical02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed there last week. The rooms were clean, the location was excellent, and the staff was very, very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone interested in staying in Ponce. Just remember that things close early on weekdays in Puerto Rico. Lola's (the attached restaurant) has great food and great service (just a bit pricey)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, sewage smell”
Reviews.Author: dearedwina
Reviews.Content: Nice room, nice restaurant, great location in front of the plaza in Ponce. Sewage smell in the room, ugh. We stayed in the new building behind the restored old pharmacy that is now the hotel lobby. Takes a while to get the attention of the front desk staff, but they stored one of our suitcases with medication behind the desk while we were out on a snorkeling tour.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Stay at your own Risk!!”
Reviews.Author: RubenV76
Reviews.Content: Beware! Stay at your own risk!!! I stayed one night and got two rooms off hotwire, the lamp shade was torn and hanging by a thread. The floor had rust going into drain, the other room the lamp button fell off and the coffee maker had old coffee grind with the slot wide open in the room. No hot water, drug addicts outside asking for money, I complained to front desk and he said prepaid reservation and non refundable and would send maintenance to fix the problems, I couldn't believe this was a Ramada hotel chain. Policeman outside guarding area to ensure tourist safety. No hot water at all not warm not not not even lukewarm. How could I get two rooms that were falling apart? The view of one room was a run down curdling paint building and the the a one way street with extreme high volume music cars passing all night from clubs. The pool the size of a bathtub width and length of three tubs. Just run down buildings and next door the burger was nasty. Complained with no avail and thank god only one night here! I will never ever ever stay here this shouldn't ever be called a hotel of 3.5 star quality?? That's a joke, even motel 6 was a better motel than this hotel. The elevator is in a underground parking to get upstairs. I'm telling you I'm from ponce and this is a shame. Go stay at the Hilton of Ponce it's more money but trust me you'll be glad you did!!! Beware!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to lay your head...”
Reviews.Author: wolfspiritgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ramada Ponce for a weekend trip to Ponce. I needed a place centrally located and easy to access. Ramada Ponce is. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was impeccably clean, cool, comfortable and spacious. Plenty of towels were supplied and the bed was extremely comfortable. My room was in the newer building. The pool was a little small for my taste (it looks bigger in the pictures). There are 'sounds from the city' that are present at night but by 11/12ish you don't really hear a thing. Traveling alone, I did feel safe within the hotel boundaries. My only complaint was the complimentary breakfast. It was a choice of sliced bread, stale cereal, and an apple with fruit punch and coffee. Needless to say I went out for breakfast at the Unique store down the block or other places in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bids_Wiederstein
Reviews.Content: Pro's: great location, new, clean, nice staff and rate$ Con's: nightlife noise, plain breakfast buffet NOTE: colonial style room does NOT have refrigerator, microwave and the A/C is controlled by hotel.

Reviews.Title: “splendid accomodations”
Reviews.Author: nycvegas
Reviews.Content: Im still here hotels bbeen open 9 months. The location is great right off the town square great for viewing the extremely limited sights in this town. There's Serralles mansion , Parque de Bombas a 117 year old firehouse, ponce's church is awesome, and souvenir shops for light shopping.For weekend excitement got to Ponce Hilton for the Casino and nightlife.The rooms have free internet ask for ethernet cable at front desk. The continental breakfast was horrible but free. The valet parking was 10.00 daily, in/out priviledges the guys were great. The rooms were huge and extremely modern, large flat screens, great beds and very quiet. The hav on site dining but I ate in the community restaurants. It is steaming hot during day so air conditioning was a welcome relief. Overall had a great stay and it was a relief from Hilton where I have stayed several times.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, stay in one of the colonial rooms!”
Reviews.Author: lhoover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Ponce after a horrible experience in San Juan. We were interested in the shopping and dining and historical sights. We considered the Hilton, Holiday Inn and the Ramada but chose the Ramada because it's in the center of town and we like to go out at night knowing that we are within walking distance to our hotel. This hotel is gorgeous! The staff is so friendly that the woman at the front desk stayed on the phone with me for 20 minutes while we foudn the place. Everyone at the front desk was helpful and even gave us a free gift for staying with them. We dined at the restaraunt, Lola's almost every night - they have a great little bar, a decent wine selection, and the food is amazing. I would definitely recommend the mahi mahi! After viewing a contemporary room and a colonial room my husband and I chose the colonial room because it was so big! King sized bed, flat panel TV, amazing glass shower that accommodates 2 :) and verandas that open to the city. The ONLY negative thing I have to say about our stay was that the stained glass on the windows and doord does allow some light into the room at night, but the bed was so comfortable we didn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Best thing about Ponce!”
Reviews.Author: Ange_from_cheshire
Reviews.Content: In this weird and less than wonderful town where the only thing to really see is the main plaza, this hotel is a real gem. Lovely, modern hotel with a great bar/restaurant. Only thing which let the hotel down was the poor breakfast - would expect much more from this standard of hotel. Feel like you are somewhere much more exciting than Ponce! Apart from spending half an hour at the plaza seeing Parque de Bombas and maybe a quick drink at the boardwalk/beach there is nothing to see in Ponce (we went here on the advice of the Lonely Planet and wish we hadn't bothered!).

Reviews.Title: “One Great Employee, Not a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Volusiababe
Reviews.Content: The Front Desk staff is very nice, especially Carlos, which is a great asset to the hotel. If you have a problem he is willing to go the extra mile to help you. In the other hand the hotel is a disgrace. I arrived to the hotel and my room was filthy. I was in a hurry to go to an activity therefore I told the hotel to clean the room. Upon my arrival from the activity the room was clean but flooded. I was lucky that my belongings were not damaged. They move us to another room and in this room the water heater was not working. I talked to a friend about the hotel and they explain to me that since the opening they are having the same problems over and over. They try to accommodate us but unfortunately it was not enough. These things should not happen in the first place. Everything should be flawless.

Reviews.Title: “Great location bad management terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Menace71
Reviews.Content: First of all the staff were unable to find our Confirmation. Dirty Rooms hand prints base of bed. Bathroom had old feces clog up. They moved us into a Handicap assesible room. Next morning the complimentary breakfast had only a bottle of Orange Juice spoke to employee he stated that is not my job. We left for the beach stopping at WAlmart to get a few things but Debit Card was declined because Ramada had a $1,500 hold on my card. I contacted the Hotel staff and they quickly returned the money to my account. After the embarrasment. Return back from beach Room floor was still dirty. I attempted to contact Hotel MAnager Jessy Portalatin she never called.

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back to this hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: CaribeTravelerpr
Reviews.Content: I stayed during the month of October at this hotel and it was not what I expected for a brand new hotel. I stayed at the first floor which you do not have easy access if you have luggage. The first floor is like the second floor since to get to it you have to take stairs. During my stay the room got flooded because the air conditioning was leaking water. When I spoke to one of the employees she told me that must of the room in the hotel has that problem since the opening. How come is October and that problem is not fixed? I do not know how people keep staying at this hotel. I will never come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lagarto2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed in August in this hotel and my experience was terrible. First when I did the reservation I asked for connecting rooms which they told me they did not have them available. What brand new renowned hotel does not have connecting rooms? Apparently this one!!! I asked then for rooms adjoining which they told me they have and will make sure they have them for me. For my surprise upon arriving they give me two rooms which they were not adjoining. I asked to speak to the general manager to address the situation and they told me they they did not have one, only an assistant general manager. What hotel does not have a general manager? Apparently this one!!!! After two days asking for the assistant manager which never shows up, I just quit looking for her. In addition of this situation the room cleanliness was terrible, the bath rooms looks like hospital bathrooms and the caring of the employees non-existent. I will not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Good Place”
Reviews.Author: mjv114
Reviews.Content: Rooms was nice, bathroom small, LCD-TV a bit small for the size of the room, rooms need more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place with great service”
Reviews.Author: tutimunoz
Reviews.Content: I stayed over the weekend of August 14th with my husband to attend a birthday party. The room was very nicely decorated, clean, spacious and comftable. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. The artwork at the lobby and other areas are from local artists and can be purchase. The food at Lola is fantastic and the ambiance is super nice. The next day we just walked around the Plaza and enjoyed the local festival during that weekend. We enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: vacationist_9
Reviews.Content: Our experience was super. The room was very comfortable and clean. The employees were very professionals and they were superb hosts. The Ramada Ponce is located in Downtown Ponce which makes it easy to visite various sites, like El Parque de Bomberos, La Plaza Las Delicias and the Cathedral, and other places were you can find history and amenities. You can just walk to the variety of bars and restaurants. The least a liked was that our vacations were to short we wanted to stay a couple of days more.

Reviews.Title: “FAMILY FUN EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: xiamensource
Reviews.Content: Stayed over during an August weekend....we have 2 kids, the rooms were nicely decorated and comfortable. The staff very friendly to our kids, the kids enjoyed the cozy pool! The restaurant.....LOVED IT! very trendy & modern, OHHH the food....great taste! :) But best of all.....Great "hot spot" location....we walked thru town "plaza" at night and enjoyed the city without needing to take the car out.........If visiting Ponce its a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “What you see is just a cover, this place is a real nightmare!!!”
Reviews.Author: HeroeSanJuan_PR
Reviews.Content: This place is a real nightmare!! I stayed with my husband and our 7 years old son. We picked this one, because we were attending my friends wedding and they gave her a special price due to a large group that made reservations at this "newly open dump". You made look at nice pictures of this hotel. but dont let this fool you. First, we were not able to checked in at the designated time because the toilet of our room was clog. Then when we finally made it to the room we notice that there were foot marks on the room floor, as if it was never moped. Then there were hairs everywhere the place :(. I found some hair pins on top of one of the tables. Then the toilet was still clog and no one was around to fix it. The wedding was the same day of the checked in and I dont even know how we ever were able to get ready in time after all this!! There is another situation with this dumpster, the contruction of this place is real chip that you can even hear every little sound from the next door rooms. Then the location is real bad. This place is located at the corner of a well transited street in the center of the town. Every little noise from out side, even the one from cars going by the street you were able to hear ten times louder than if you were actually in the street. So, this will not be a good place for a good night sleep. We were all unable to sleep when we return from the wedding that night. The people of the room next door were soo loud the administration almost called the cops on them. Then we were moved at 2:30 am to another room that was supposed to be better, but it was actually worst than the first one. The next day we packed our stuff and decided to stayed at the Ponce Hilton and casino which is a very good hotel with amazing service and comodities. Finally, all I can suggest you is to avoir staying at the Ramada Hotel, it was our very worst hotel experience ever!!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Ponce Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Reina | Downtown Across Main Plaza, Ponce 00731, Puerto Rico
